info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 7 at 9:51AM EDT until April 7 at 10:45AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following county, Haywood.
* WHEN...Until 1045 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 946 AM EDT, Doppler radar was showing that rain had come to an end across the advised area. After a 3 inch rainfall, high levels of runoff will linger through the Richland, Jonathan's and Cataloochee Creek basins. Continue to monitor stream rises and flooding of low-lying areas along these creeks this morning.
- Some locations that may experience flooding include... Waynesville, Lake Junaluska and Maggie Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via X using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EDT THIS MORNING
